snippet: A senior Iraqi official has told the Obama administration that Iraq no longer has a legal basis to hold Ali Musa Daqduq, who has been accused of helping to kill American troops in Iraq.
abstract: Senior Iraqi official tells Obama administration that Iraq no longer has legal basis to hold Ali Musa Daqduq, Lebanese Hezbollah operative who has been accused of helping to kill American troops in Iraq; United States officials are concerned that he may soon be released.
lead_paragraph: A senior Iraqi official has told the Obama administration that Iraq no longer has a legal basis to hold Ali Musa Daqduq, who has been accused of helping to kill American troops in Iraq.

headline.seo: U.S. Fears Hezbollah Operative Held in Iraq May Go Free
headline.main: U.S. Fears Hezbollah Operative Held in Iraq May Go Free
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fears Hezbollah Operative Held in Iraq May Go Free
